about.name: Tokyo
about.info_text: Tokyo, the bustling capital of Japan, is a vibrant metropolis where modernity and tradition coexist. Known for its cutting-edge technology, lively street scenes, and historic temples, Tokyo offers an unforgettable experience. Visitors can explore trendy neighborhoods like Shibuya and Harajuku, dine on world-class cuisine, and immerse themselves in the rich culture and history of Japan. Tokyo is a city of endless possibilities, where the past meets the future.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 14 million
Prefecture: Tokyo Metropolis
Time Zone: Japan Standard Time (UTC+09:00)
Language: Japanese
Currency: Japanese Yen (JPY)
about.climate_text: Tokyo has a humid subtropical climate with distinct seasons. Summers are warm and humid, while winters are cool and dry. Spring is famous for cherry blossoms, and autumn offers pleasant temperatures.

attractions_card.title: Senso-ji Temple
attractions_card.description: Senso-ji is Tokyo's oldest temple and a popular destination in Asakusa, known for its iconic Thunder Gate and shopping street.

attractions_card.title: Shibuya Crossing
attractions_card.description: Shibuya Crossing is one of the busiest pedestrian intersections globally, creating a mesmerizing spectacle when the lights change.

attractions_card.title: Tokyo Skytree
attractions_card.description: Tokyo Skytree is an iconic tower that provides breathtaking panoramic views of the city and is a symbol of modern Tokyo.

attractions_card.title: Meiji Shrine
attractions_card.description: Meiji Shrine is a serene Shinto shrine located in the heart of Tokyo, offering a peaceful escape from the urban hustle and bustle.

attractions_card.title: Ueno Park
attractions_card.description: Ueno Park is a spacious public park with museums, a zoo, and cherry blossoms in spring, making it a favorite spot for both locals and tourists.

attractions_card.title: Odaiba
attractions_card.description: Odaiba is a futuristic entertainment and shopping district located on a man-made island in Tokyo Bay, featuring unique architecture and attractions.

attractions_card.title: Ginza Shopping District
attractions_card.description: Ginza is Tokyo's upscale shopping district, known for luxury boutiques, department stores, and art galleries.

attractions_card.title: Akihabara
attractions_card.description: Akihabara is the hub of Japanese pop culture, electronics, and anime, making it a paradise for enthusiasts and gamers.

food_card.title: Sushi
food_card.description: Tokyo offers world-class sushi, with numerous Michelin-starred sushi restaurants where you can savor the freshest fish and expert craftsmanship.

food_card.title: Ramen
food_card.description: Ramen shops are abundant in Tokyo, serving a variety of flavors and styles, from rich tonkotsu to savory shoyu ramen.

food_card.title: Tempura
food_card.description: Tempura is a delightful Japanese dish of lightly battered and deep-fried seafood and vegetables, with restaurants known for their artful preparation.

food_card.title: Yakitori
food_card.description: Yakitori restaurants serve skewered and grilled chicken, a popular dish enjoyed with drinks in izakayas.

hotels_card.title: Park Hyatt Tokyo
hotels_card.description: Park Hyatt Tokyo is an iconic luxury hotel featured in the film 'Lost in Translation,' known for its panoramic views and exceptional service.

hotels_card.title: Aman Tokyo
hotels_card.description: Aman Tokyo is a tranquil oasis in the heart of the city, offering spacious and beautifully designed rooms, traditional Japanese baths, and stunning city views.

hotels_card.title: Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
hotels_card.description: Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo is a five-star hotel located in the Nihonbashi business district, featuring luxurious accommodations and gourmet dining options.

hotels_card.title: The Peninsula Tokyo
hotels_card.description: The Peninsula Tokyo is a grand hotel offering opulent rooms, a rooftop bar with panoramic views, and easy access to Tokyo's top attractions.

transport_card.title: Tokyo Metro
transport_card.description: The Tokyo Metro is an extensive subway system that provides efficient transportation throughout the city, with multiple lines serving different areas.

transport_card.title: JR Yamanote Line
transport_card.description: The JR Yamanote Line is a circular train line that connects major neighborhoods in Tokyo, making it a convenient way to get around the city.

transport_card.title: Tokyo Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis in Tokyo are safe and reliable, with professional drivers and well-maintained vehicles, although they can be relatively expensive.

transport_card.title: Toei Buses
transport_card.description: Toei Buses provide bus services within Tokyo, offering an alternative mode of transportation to explore the city's neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: Narita International Airport
transport_card.description: Narita International Airport is one of Tokyo's major airports, serving international flights and offering various transportation options to the city center.

transport_card.title: Haneda Airport
transport_card.description: Haneda Airport is Tokyo's primary domestic airport and handles some international flights, providing easy access to the city center.
